articles.title: Anthropic’s new Cowork tool offers Claude Code without the code
articles.description: Built into the Claude Desktop app, Cowork lets users designate a specific folder where Claude can read or modify files, with further instructions given through the standard chat interface.

articles.title: Fintech firm Betterment confirms data breach after hackers send fake crypto scam notification to users
articles.description: Hackers gained access to some Betterment customers’ personal information through a social engineering attack, then targeted some of them with a crypto-related phishing message.

Important changes and trends in the IT industry
articles.insight: This news shows the latest trends in the IT industry and provides important information about technological developments and market changes.

articles.title: Developers have made $550 billion on Apple’s App Store since 2008
articles.description: Apple says its services had a "record-breaking year," as Apple TV, Apple Music, and Apple Pay also soared.
articles.summary: In the past decade since it launched in 2008, developers have earned $550 billion on iOS devices through its App Store.
points: - Developers' revenue from Apple’s App Store surpassed $550 billion since launch
- The record was reported amidst a 'record-breaking year' for all of Apple's services, including TV, Music and Payments
- Despite developers earning billions annually through the platform
articles.insight: The article highlights how critical iOS devices have been in driving developer revenue. The trend suggests that platforms like App Store continue to generate substantial income for app creators.

articles.title: Google’s Gemini to power Apple’s AI features like Siri
articles.description: Apple and Google have embarked on a non-exclusive, multi-year partnership that will involve Apple using Gemini models and Google cloud technology for future foundational models.
articles.summary: Apple has partnered with Google to use its AI model, Gemini, along with Google's cloud infrastructure in developing the backbone of Apple products such as Siri.
points: Apple and Google have formed a multi-year non-exclusive partnership focusing on using each other’s technologies for foundational models.
The collaboration will integrate Gemini, one of Google's latest AI models developed by the DeepMind team, with Apple products like Siri to enhance user experience and capabilities.
Apple plans to use this partnership primarily on its cloud infrastructure in an effort not just for hardware but software as well.
articles.insight: This collaboration indicates a growing trend of tech giants combining their strengths to push the boundaries of AI technology and user experience. It could lead to significant advancements in voice assistants, with more natural interaction capabilities across platforms.

articles.title: Paramount files lawsuit against Warner Bros. amidst controversial Netflix merger
articles.description: Paramount has filed a lawsuit against Warner Bros. Discovery, demanding greater financial disclosure regarding Netflix's $82.7 billion acquisition.
articles.summary: Paramount is suing Warner Bros for transparency in its massive deal with Netflix.
points: Paramount files a lawsuit against Warner Bros demanding financial disclosure from the $82.bon acquisition by Netflix
The controversy stems from concerns about whether Paramount is being unfairly treated in comparison to other companies involved.
This legal action could potentially set precedents for how tech mergers and acquisitions are reported financially.
articles.insight: Paramount's lawsuit against Warner Bros may force greater financial transparency within the industry, influencing future dealings with major streaming services like Netflix. It also highlights growing scrutiny over these significant deals in Hollywood and their implications for smaller studios.

articles.title: A New Jersey lawsuit shows how hard it is to fight deepfake porn
articles.description: For more than two years, an app called ClothOff has been terrorizing young women online — and it’s been maddeningly difficult to stop. The app has been taken down from the two major app stores and it’s banned from most social platforms, but it’s still available on the web and through a Telegram bot. In […]
articles.summary: A New Jersey lawsuit highlights challenges in combating deepfake porn targeting young women online, as evidenced by the persistence of an app called ClothOff.
points: App named 'ClothOff' targets and shares real images manipulated into non-consensual explicit content without consent
Despite being banned from major platforms, it continues to operate on lesser-regulated channels such as the web and Telegram
The case exposes gaps in legal recourse for victims of digital exploitation
articles.insight: This news serves as a stark reminder that technology can be misused, even leading to real harm. It underscores an urgent need for robust measures and international cooperation to address online sexual harassment.

articles.title: Netflix had a huge night at the 2026 Golden Globes with 7 wins
articles.description: As Netflix gears up to acquire Warner Bros., the streaming giant took home 7 awards at the Golden Globes last night.
articles.summary: Netflix celebrated a significant achievement with seven wins at this year'nerst Golden Globe Awards ceremony.
points: 7 awards for Netflix indicate its strong content performance and recognition within the entertainment industry.
articles.insight: With consistent success in major award ceremonies, Netflix strengthens its position as a leading global streaming service with diverse and high-quality original programming that resonates strongly with viewers. This trend suggests increasing competition among other studios to produce content capable of competing on this platform.

articles.title: Luminar lines up $22 million bidder for its lidar business
articles.description: The bid comes from Quantum Computing Inc., which already lined up to buy Luminar's semiconductor division. Luminar founder Austin Russell has also expressed interest.
articles.summary: Quantum Computing Inc. is set to acquire Luminar' end-to-end lidar business with a bid of $22 million following an agreement for the sale of its semiconductor division.
points: Austin Russell, founder of Luminar, has been actively involved in finding buyers as he prepares to leave his company post-acquisition. He previously sold a significant portion (80%) of equity stake but remains with the firm through its transition phase.

Quantum Computing Inc., which is interested in acquiring Luminar's semiconductor division, has now extended an offer to purchase all remaining assets including lidar business from Luminar Holdings. The deal includes a $20 million cash payment and warrants for 4% of Quantum.
Lidar technology is expected to play a crucial role in autonomous vehicle development, with industry experts predicting that this sector will experience substantial growth.
articles.insight: The acquisition highlights the increasing integration and specialization within the field of advanced sensor technologies. As lidar plays an important part in developing self-driving cars, Quantum Computing Inc.'s investment could signify a shift towards more focused approaches to technology development that facilitate rapid growth industries like autonomous vehicles.

articles.title: Meta hires former Trump advisor Dina Powell McCormick as president and vice chair
articles.description: Powell McCormick served as deputy national security advisor to President Donald Trump.
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has hired Dina Powell McCormick, a former adviser in the National Security Council of President Donald Trump's administration, as its new president and vice chair.
points: Dina Powell McCormick joins Meta with experience from her role at Uber Technologies Inc. where she served as executive director for global operations before becoming an adviser in the National Security Council of President Donald Trump' end
The hiring decision was announced during a call by Mark Zuckerberg, who said that he and COO Sheryl Sandberg were looking to find new leaders with diverse backgrounds.
McCormick will be assisting in the areas including global growth strategy development for Meta' s mobile platform
articles.insight: This hiring reflects a trend towards diversifying leadership within technology companies, bringing experience from sectors beyond just Silicon Valley. As McCormick brings her extensive background to this role at one of the world’s leading social media platforms, she can potentially offer valuable insights into global operations and strategies.

articles.title: Harmattan AI raises $200M Series B led by Dassault Aviation, becomes defense unicorn
articles.description: French defense tech company Harmattan AI is now valued at $1.4 billion after raising a $200 million Series B round led by Dassault Aviation, which is best known for making the Rafale fighter jet.
articles.summary: Harmattan AI, a French defense tech company specializing in artificial intelligence solutions for military applications, has successfully raised $200 million in Series B funding led by Dassault Aviation.
points: French defence firm Harmattan raises $200M from investors including 'Dassault'
Investment expected to enhance the capabilities of artificial intelligence systems for military use, with a valuation estimate now at over $1.4 billion
'Unicorn' status achieved within defense tech sector
articles.insight: Harmattan AI' endorsement by Dassault—the Rafale fighter jet manufacturer—is indicative of significant confidence in the firm from established players, promising an influx of resources to drive innovation and competitiveness within military-focused artificial intelligence.

articles.title: [2026 방화벽 정책관리 솔루션 리포트] AI와 자동화로 정책은 물론 보안까지 사로잡다

articles.title: These Gen Zers just raised $11.75M to put Africa’s defense back in the hands of Africans
articles.description: African defense company Terra comes out of stealth with a $11.75M round led by Joe Lonsdale's 8VC.
articles.summary: Terra Defense has raised over $11 million from investors like Joe Lonsdale to develop defense technology for African nations.
points: African defense company Terra raises significant funds led by '8VC'.
The venture aims to restore self-defense capabilities of Africa back to Africans themselves, challenging the continent' enduring reliance on foreign aid for security.
Investment in African technology sectors like this could significantly shift economic balance and power dynamics within sub-Saharan regions.
articles.insight: This investment signifies a growing trend of empowering local technologies to enhance self-reliance, potentially leading to increased sovereignty for African nations in the long run.

articles.title: 41개 중소기업, KISIA 지원 랜섬웨어 대응 솔루션으로 보안 공백 극복

articles.title: [AI와 보안] 자율주행·IoT·몰카... ‘생활’에 훅 들어온 AI 보안, CES 2026 빛냈다
articles.description: [3줄요약] 1. AI 기반 자율주행, 접근 단속으로 차량·이용자 보안2. 일상 속 AI 기기·몰카로부터 개인정보·회사 기밀 등 보안3. “생성형 AI에서 ‘작동하는 AI’로 본격 전환”[보안뉴스 강현주 기자] 라스베이거스에서 9일(현지시간) 화려한 막을 내린 CES 2026은 인공지능(AI)이 생활 속 현실로 다가왔음을 알려준 행사였다. 이를 뒷받침 해주

articles.title: inDrive turns to ads and groceries to diversify revenue
articles.description: Advertising on inDrive is being rolled out across its top 20 markets following mid-2025 tests.
articles.summary: inDrive plans to introduce advertisements and sell groceries in major markets as new revenue streams after a successful test phase.
points: inDrive is expanding its services beyond ride-hailing with the introduction of ads on their platform, starting from mid-2025 across top 2 end regions and cities like New York City
The company'third quarter earnings report showed a decline in revenue but an increase in profitability due to cost savings.
inDrive will begin selling fresh groceries within its platform, partnering with local food retailers
articles.insight: The move signifies the company's strategic shift towards diversification and long-term sustainability in a competitive market.

articles.title: Motional puts AI at center of robotaxi reboot as it targets 2026 for driverless service
articles.description: Motional says it will launch a driverless robotaxi service in Las Vegas before the end of 2026.
articles.summary: Volvo's subsidiary Motional plans to introduce an autonomous vehicle ride-hailing service in Las Vegas by the end of 2term
points: Motional, a Volvo subsidiary, will offer driverless robotaxi services.
The launch is set for before the year's end 2026.
Las Vegas has been chosen as the service location.
articles.insight: This development signifies major strides towards commercializing autonomous vehicle technology, indicating a high level of trust in AI systems by Motional and could lead to widespread adoption if successful.

articles.title: Google co-founders may be leaving California
articles.description: Sergey Brin and Larry Page appear to be pulling back from the state where they co-founded Google.
articles.summary: Google's founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page may renounce California citizenship, potentially affecting their tax obligations to one of the country's most lucrdependent states.
points: Sergey Brin and Larry Page are reportedly planning on relinquishing their Californian residency statuses.
This move could save them significant amounts in state income tax, which is particularly relevant given Google's substantial revenue generation from its headquarters located in California.
The decision by the founders has sparked a broader debate about high-earning tech CEOs and their contributions to states where they do not reside.
articles.insight: This development may signal other prominent technology figures reconsidering tax strategies in light of increasing scrutiny over state fiscal benefits, potentially influencing broader corporate governance practices within the tech industry and beyond.

articles.title: Instagram says there’s been ‘no breach’ despite password reset requests
articles.description: Instagram says that although some users received suspicious-looking password reset requests, it has not been breached.
articles.summary: Despite receiving unexpected password reset emails, Instagram reports there hasn't been a security breach.
points: - Some users reported getting unsolicited and suspicious-looking password reset requests from an email address not affiliated with the social media platform.
- In response to these incidents affecting thousands of accounts, Instagram has confirmed that there is no security breach at this time.
- The company's spokesperson suggested user vigilance and advised them never to click on links from unfamiliar sources or provide personal information without confirming the sender.
articles.insight: Instagram continues monitoring for potential threats while reassuring users of their platform security, emphasizing proactive cybersecurity measures in a landscape where phishing attacks are increasingly common. This incident highlights the importance of user awareness and caution when handling personal information online.

articles.title: Google removes AI Overviews for certain medical queries
articles.description: This follows an investigation by the Guardian that found Google AI Overviews offering misleading information in response to some health-related queries.
articles.summary: Google has removed artificial intelligence (AI) overviews from its search results for specific medical questions following an investigation by the Guardian that highlighted misleading information.
points: An investigation led to Google's decision
Removed AI Overviews offering inaccurate health info
Google responding to user concerns and data accuracy
articles.insight: The incident highlights the importance of accurate information dissemination by major tech companies, especially when it involves critical areas such as medical advice. It also underlines growing public demand for reliable sources in health-related queries.

articles.title: Nuclear startups are back in vogue with small reactors, and big challenges
articles.description: Small modular reactor startups are betting that mass manufacturing will help them bring costs down. But are they underestimating the challenge?
articles.summary: Nuclear startup companies see small modular reactors (SMRs) as a viable option to reduce costs through mass production. However, experts question if these startups have fully grasped the challenges involved.
points: Small modular reactor startups are banking on cost reduction via large-scale manufacturing of nuclear reactors
Experts and former U.CTrains staff express concerns about underestimating the complexity, especially in safety aspects of SMRs
The industry has evolved to address past mistakes with modern designs like Westinghouse's AP1000 but remains cautious
articles.insight: This news suggests a continued interest and investment into nuclear startups despite acknowledged challenges, indicating that cost-reduction through mass production could be key to the industry’s growth.

articles.title: Indonesia and Malaysia block Grok over non-consensual, sexualized deepfakes
articles.description: Indonesian officials said Saturday that they are temporarily blocking access to xAI’s chatbot Grok.
articles.summary: Indonesia and Malaysia have blocked the AI-powered deepfake detection chatbot named 'Grok,' following a video allegedly portraying non-consensual sexual acts.
points: The Indonesian Ministry of Communication, along with its counterpart in neighboring Malaysia, has temporarily blocked access to Grok due to concerns over content spread via the chatbot
Grok was designed by a team from Microsoft's AI research division as an interactive guide for discussions on misinformation and deepfake detection.
The Indonesian Ministry of Communication claims that there has been 'excessive use' of Grok, leading to the decision to block it.
articles.insight: This incident highlights growing concerns among Southeast Asian governments regarding AI tools used in deepfake detection and their potential misuse. It undersceneres urgent need for clear guidelines on ethical usage of such technologies, particularly within the sensitive cultural context.

articles.title: Wing to expand drone delivery to another 150 Walmart stores
articles.description: The partnership will grow Wing's drone delivery service to more than 270 Walmart stores by 2027.
articles.summary: Wing Airlines is set to expand its successful drone delivery services in partnership with Walmart into additional locations.
points: The Wing and Walmart collaboration will extend drones' service areas by overcoming federal aviation regulation barriers.
By next year, the initial phase aims to provide deliveries within five miles of stores from takeoff pads in backyards or yards near retailers.
articles.insight: This partnership could normalize drone delivery as a common service model for e-commerce and expedite technological advancements while addressing regulatory constraints, potentially transforming logistics industry practices by mid to late decade.

articles.title: Google announces a new protocol to facilitate commerce using AI agents
articles.description: Google said that merchants can now offer discounts to users directly in AI mode results
articles.summary: Google has announced a new protocol allowing for the direct offering of user-specific discounts by artificial intelligence (AI) agents within its search engine's result pages.
points: Merchants can now offer AI-generated, personalized discounts directly in Google Search results.

This new protocol integrates with the company' endorsed shopping platform and is expected to enhance customer experience by offering tailored deals as users shop online or search for products/services related services.
The integration of AI into commerce facilitated through a major tech giant like Google indicates an increasingly important role that artificial intelligence plays in the future economy.
articles.insight: This development underscores the growing importance and normalization of using Artificial Intelligence within e-commerce, which could potentially reshape online shopping experiences by providing hyper-personalized offers to consumers at scale. Moreover, this partnership between Google's vast user base and its AI initiatives may provide a competitive edge in the digital marketplace.

articles.title: SpaceX gets FCC approval to launch 7,500 more Starlink satellites
articles.description: The Federal Communications Commission has given SpaceX approval to launch another 7,500 of its second generation Starlink satellites.
articles.summary: SpaceX received FCC authorization for an additional batch of 7,500 next-generation Starlink satellites to enhance global broadband coverage.
points: The Federal Communications Commission has approved SpaceX's request to launch more than double its existing fleet size with the second generation Starlink satellites (around 12,500 planned in total).
These new satellites are designed to provide faster and cheaper broadband services worldwide.
The approval process took into consideration SpaceX's measures for minimizing space debris.
articles.insight: This news reflects the increasing competition in providing satellite-based internet services, which could potentially reshape global connectivity and access to information. Additionally, with concerns about space junk growing alongside launch activities, it demonstrates SpaceX's awareness of environmental responsibility.

articles.title: OpenAI is reportedly asking contractors to upload real work from past jobs
articles.description: An intellectual property lawyer says OpenAI is "putting itself at great risk" with this approach.
articles.summary: OpenAI reportedly asks contractors to submit real work from previous jobs for analysis via GPT-3 and Stable Diffusion models.
points: Contractors are asked to upload examples of past artworks or writing tasks they've completed, without mentioning OpenAI explicitly in the submission process.
OpenAI allegedly uses these submissions as a training dataset for AI systems like GPT-3 and Stable Diffusion without contractor consent.
This practice raises significant concerns about intellectual property rights and informed consent.
articles.insight: The reported behavior of OpenAI, if true, could have far-reaching implications on trust in AI development companies regarding user data privacy and the handling of proprietary content. It also highlights a potential lapse in ethical standards that may affect industry reputation.

articles.title: Indonesia blocks Grok over non-consensual, sexualized deepfakes
articles.description: Indonesian officials said Saturday that they are temporarily blocking access to xAI’s chatbot Grok.
articles.summary: The Indonesian government has blocked the artificial intelligence-powered deepfake detection and reporting bot named 'Grok,' due to concerns about its non-consensual use of sexualized content for generating fake videos.
points: Indonesia blocks Grok over non-consensual, sexualized deepfakes
Accessibility issue regarding the misuse in creating false representations online by exploiting sensitive data without consent
Temporary action taken reflects broader ethical concerns and governance needs within AI
articles.insight: This move highlights growing global attention to ensuring that artificial intelligence is used responsibly, especially when dealing with sensitive content like sexually explicit material. It indicates an industry-wide push towards establishing more stringent regulatory frameworks for AI deployment.
